Wilmette, Illinois, USA: Bahá'í Publishing Trust. p.&#160;25. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-85398-999-0" title="Special:BookSources/0-85398-999-0">0-85398-999-0</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.au=Bah%C3%A1%27u%27ll%C3%A1h&amp;rft.btitle=The+Kit%C3%A1b-i-Aqdas%3A+The+Most+Holy+Book&amp;rft.date=1992&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Freference.bahai.org%2Fen%2Ft%2Fb%2FKA%2Fka-4.html.iso8859-1%23pg25&amp;rft.isbn=0-85398-999-0&amp;rft.pages=25&amp;rft.place=Wilmette%2C+Illinois%2C+USA&amp;rft.pub=Bah%C3%A1%27%C3+Publishing+Trust&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-iranica-147"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-iranica_147-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation encyclopaedia">MacEoin, Dennis (1989). "Bahai Calendar and Festivals". <i>Encyclopædia Iranica</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.atitle=Bahai+Calendar+and+Festivals&amp;rft.aufirst=Dennis&amp;rft.aulast=MacEoin&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclop%C3%A6dia+Iranica&amp;rft.date=1989&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-148"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-148">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">`Abdu'l-Bahá (1913-03-21). "Star of the West". <b>4</b> (1): 4.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.atitle=Star+of+the+West&amp;rft.au=%60Abdu%27l-Bah%C3%A1&amp;rft.date=1913-03-21&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=4&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.volume=4" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span> republished in <cite class="citation book">Effendi, Shoghi; The Universal House of Justice (1983). Hornby, Helen, ed. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://bahai-library.com/hornby_lights_guidance"><i>Lights of Guidance: A Bahá'í Reference File</i></a>. Bahá'í Publishing Trust, New Delhi, India. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/81-85091-46-3" title="Special:BookSources/81-85091-46-3">81-85091-46-3</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.aufirst=Shoghi&amp;rft.aulast=Effendi&amp;rft.au=The+Universal+House+of+Justice&amp;rft.btitle=Lights+of+Guidance%3A+A+Bah%C3%A1%27%C3+Reference+File&amp;rft.date=1983&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fbahai-library.com%2Fhornby_lights_guidance&amp;rft.isbn=81-85091-46-3&amp;rft.pub=Bah%C3%A1%27%C3+Publishing+Trust%2C+New+Delhi%2C+India&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-149"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-149">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.amaana.org/ismaili/nawruz-persian-new-year/">"Nowruz Persian New Year – Eid Mubarak! | Ismaili Web Amaana"</a>. <i>Amaana.org</i>. 15 March 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 March</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.atitle=Nowruz+Persian+New+Year+%26%238211%3B+Eid+Mubarak%21+%26%23124%3B+Ismaili+Web+Amaana&amp;rft.date=2013-03-15&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.amaana.org%2Fismaili%2Fnawruz-persian-new-year%2F&amp;rft.jtitle=Amaana.org&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-150"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-150">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.theismaili.org/cms/960/Navroz">"Navroz"</a>. TheIsmaili.org. 18 March 2010<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 May</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.btitle=Navroz&amp;rft.date=2010-03-18&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theismaili.org%2Fcms%2F960%2FNavroz&amp;rft.pub=TheIsmaili.org&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-151"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-151">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Mireskandari, Anousheh (March 2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ic-el.com/en/old/show_news.asp?idnum=61&amp;state=article">"Nowruz in Islam"</a>. Islamic Centre of England<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 March</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANowruz&amp;rft.au=Mireskandari%2C+Anousheh&amp;rft.btitle=Nowruz+in+Islam&amp;rft.date=2012-03&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ic-el.com%2Fen%2Fold%2Fshow_news.asp%3Fidnum%3D61%26state%3Darticle&amp;rft.pub=Islamic+Centre+of+England&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-152"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-152">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Tahrir_al_Wasila" class="mw-redirect" title="Tahrir al Wasila">Tahrir al Wasila</a>, by Ayatollah Khomeini, Vol. 1, pg. 302–303</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-153"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-153">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Islamic_Laws" title="Islamic Laws">Islamic Laws</a>, by Ali al-Sistani, under the section; "Mustahab Fasts"</span></li>
</ol>
</div>

<table role="presentation" class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000">
<tr>

<tr>
<th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="#bfd7ff">Months</th>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Fravashi" title="Fravashi">Fravardin</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Asha" title="Asha">Ardibehest</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Khordad" title="Khordad">Khordad</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Tishtrya" title="Tishtrya">Tir</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spenta_Armaiti" title="Spenta Armaiti">Amardad</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Kshathra_Vairya" class="mw-redirect" title="Kshathra Vairya">Shehrevar</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Mithra" title="Mithra">Meher</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Aban" title="Aban">Avan</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Atar" title="Atar">Adar</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Spenta_Armaiti" title="Spenta Armaiti">Aspandarmad</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
